meanings.definition: A person who talks at length without making much sense.
meanings.sent1: The blatherers in the meeting kept going on and on without making any sense.
meanings.sent2: The group of blatherers at the party were chatting endlessly without any clear point.
meanings.sent3: The blatherers in the comedy show had the audience laughing at their nonsensical ramblings.
meanings.sent4: The blatherers in the classroom were like noisy birds chirping without a purpose.
meanings.sent5: The blatherers in the park were like a broken record, repeating the same meaningless words over and over.

meanings.definition: To talk long-windedly without saying anything of value.
meanings.sent1: She blatherers on the phone for hours without getting to the point.
meanings.sent2: He blatherers during meetings, making them longer than necessary.
meanings.sent3: The politician blatherers during debates, hoping to confuse the audience.
meanings.sent4: The teacher blatherers during lectures, putting the students to sleep.
meanings.sent5: The radio host blatherers on air, filling the time with empty words.
